snippet: During World War II, the Army called on soldiers from artistic fields for a project requiring creative deception.
abstract: Army called on World War II soldiers with artist backgrounds, including designer Bill Blass, to create fake tanks and trucks from portable materials like inflatable rubber, fooling German military into thinking Allied troops were in area, and allowing actual units to move more freely; remarkable story of efforts is subject of upcoming PBS documentary The Ghost Army, produced by Rick Beyer.
lead_paragraph: During World War II, the Army called on soldiers from artistic fields for a project requiring creative deception.
